attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays from 6 weeks to 2.
attributes.background: As a working parent I find it almost impossible to find affordable childcare for my children during the 6 weeks holidays. Most people only receive 21 days annual leave from work.
attributes.additional_details: With lack of affordable childcare for primary and high school aged children, it makes it almost impossible for most parents to find or afford childcare for the six week summer holiday. We need to move with the times and support people who want to work. Children are no longer required to help with summer harvest. 6 weeks is too long!

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: 2 p should be put on income tax solely for the purpose of funding NHS resources
attributes.background: Background??? - look around - ask people - take a (cynical) look at the news - ask your GP - ask the next person you see in a wheelchair - visit any oncology unit - If nothing's done a lot of people will die a cold, lonely, painful, hideous death

attributes.action: Bigger fine instant ban for people who are caught driving while on the phone
attributes.background: I'm sure many of u like me are sick of seeing people texting or on the phone while driving, I for one think the new fines points etc is a complete joke. I see it on school runs right next to schools people texting or on their phone, enough is enough make it a instant ban and 5 grand fine

attributes.action: Remove the unecessary, excessively armed, MoD presence in Scotland
attributes.background: The Rosneath peninsula in Scotland is home to a widely unpopular military installation. The MoD have, with little to no consultation with the local population, increased their presence in the region. This needs to be undone handing back Scottish policing to Police Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: In a move the government has justified with maintaining national security more weapons and officers with more of a will to use them are being placed in rural Scotland. This is supposedly to defend a military installation which many Scots do not want on their land and do not want so dangerously close to their population centres.

attributes.action: Parliament to amend the law, requiring all councils to provide textile recycling
attributes.background:
Textile recycling should be introduced as mandatory into every single home in the U.K. 
There should also be a module introduced into schools on the importance of recycling & social responsibility. Communicating the textile recycling message to both homedwellers and dependants educated in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K clothing sector is responsible for more than 3m tonnes of co2 emissions.
consuming 2.16m tonnes of clothing and textiles/year, spending approx £38.4bn on clothing alone.

Households in the uk send more than 18.8m tonnes of rubbish (1.4m textiles) to landfill every year-2m tonnes more than EU counterparts.

U.K landfill rates are growing faster each year, emitting methane gas and accelerating climate change.

Anyone serious about tackling global warming should support efforts to recycle.

attributes.action: Put a cap on homework for under 17's
attributes.background: The amount of homework is decided by the education minister, who signs acts that will never directly effect him. It has been shown by several studies that excessive amounts of homework can lead to depression, anxiety and even lower grades. I think there should be a cap on homework to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
My sources:
https://factualfacts.com/science-facts/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades-studies-suggest/

http://www.mindmake.com/blog/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/the-squeaky-wheel/201110/how-much-homework-is-too-much

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: Make eateries develop a menu accessible and readable for all
attributes.background: After a recent meal out with people with learning disabilities I found myself wondering why, with all the focus on rights and choice there was no easy read menu. One non-verbal service user had to just eat what was chosen for him, whereas if there were menus with photos he could choose for himself.
attributes.additional_details: It would not take much for restaurants and cafes to develop a photo menu, as well as a menu in braille. There is huge focus on treating people equally in society these days, yet in so many establishments a large amount of the population are ignored. We now have wheelchair access in most places for physically disabled people so it's about time all disabled people were considered.

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's decision to 'ban' Lettings Agency applicant/tenant fees
attributes.background: The decision by the Government to 'ban' applicant/tenant fees is poorly conceived and of little benefit to tenants or the economy of the UK. In addition, this 'ban' goes against the very grain/ideology of a 'free market' economy.
attributes.additional_details: The announced plans to 'ban' (outright) the ability for Lettings Agencies to charge fees to applicants/tenants is based on a fundamental misunderstanding by the government as to how Lettings Agencies/Landlords are required to operate. The Government implies that tenants do not have a choice as to which property they wish to rent or which agency they wish to use, which displays an inherent lack of understanding as to how the property industry functions and what is required of it.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Increase funding for local authorities for Adult Social Care in England
attributes.background: The elderly should have the right to be entitled to remain in their own homes receiving a high standard of care with dignity and respect, until palliative care if required. This should include continuity of care & time to cover all tasks required for the individual with trained care assistants.
attributes.additional_details: I am a registered care manager for a leading care provider who offers the highest standards of care with highly trained and qualified staff. Every week we have customers with specialist needs I.E. dementia, who do not have the time allowed by our local authority due to financial restrictions, or choosing a low standard of care agency who are non compliant due to funding.  This has to stop. This should not be a financial lottery.

attributes.action: Make tractor drivers pass a HGV test due to to the weights tractors can now haul
attributes.background: Tractor tests have been very simple since the war, the machines themselves have got larger in comparison, the power and weight hauling capability has also increased, but the drivers exprience or knowledge has not. A tractor slid across a field with a near miss of children who were on adjacent land.

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to see if UK citizens wish to keep all their current rights.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that a Referendum be held to see if there is public support for the adoption of new legislation, of whatever kind, by Parliament or other executive means, that will result in the loss or modification of any rights currently held by every UK citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the form of the Referendum should be two questions as follows:

YES. I agree to the adoption by Parliament of new legislation that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK Citizen.

NO. I do not agree to the adoption of new legislation by Parliament that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK citizen.

Currently, Parliament seems set on invoking legislation that will result in the loss of rights by all.

attributes.action: Treat Halls of Residence as commercial premises for TV licence purposes
attributes.background: Halls of residence are little more than self catering Hotels or Hostels.  Students share "Flats" with on average 8 other students. Although they have their own room (as they do at home and don't need their own licence).Yet every student has to pay for their own licence! This is an unfair system.
attributes.additional_details: A 50 bedroom hostel would pay £145.50 for the first 15 units and £145.50 for every 5 units after that. So its total cost would be £1164.00 which divided by 50 people is only £23.28 each per year. However in a 50 room hall of residence each student has to pay £145.50 because their rooms include receiving equipment/sockets, whether they use them or not. The total cost raised for the BBC is £7275 (more if paid in installments) If students can't have free TV then at least make the system fair.

attributes.action: Reduce the full time working week to 35 hours, without lowering current salary.
attributes.background:
The UK Government needs to tackle the long-hours culture & promote a restructuring of working time (max 35 hours per week) and the way in which people work such as flexible working.

People who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work & health than those who do not.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the 2011 Workplace Employment Relations Study (WERS), 41% of employees agreed or strongly agreed with the statement: ‘People in this workplace who want to progress usually have to put in long hours.’ 

According to the Fifth European Working Conditions Survey, people who work more than 48 hours per week report more problems in terms of work and health than those who do not.

attributes.action: Restrict drivers aged 17-22 to cars limited to 40mph and 0-60mph 15 secs
attributes.background: It is common to see young drivers driving badly, too fast, aggressively,  and involved in accidents that cause death and injury to themselves and others. I believe it would be a relatively easy step to restrict the power and speed of cars driven by young drivers.
attributes.additional_details: It would require car manufacturers to create a new range of restricted, but affordable cars, that would also lead to cheaper insurance for first time drivers.

attributes.action: Offer teachers salary sacrifice car scheme
attributes.background: Sources continue to raise awareness of the teacher shortage crisis. Even though there are initiatives to recruit new teachers, more needs to be done to retain the best teachers by offering incentives such as a car salary sacrifice schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationopinion/12182027/How-to-solve-the-teacher-recruitment-crisis.html

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

http://www.fleetnews.co.uk/news/fleet-industry-news/2015/06/01/government-to-consider-salary-sacrifice-car-schemes-for-teachers

attributes.action: Stop Sexual Harrassment in Schools
attributes.background:
A 2010 YouGov poll of 16-18 year olds found 29% of girls experienced unwanted sexual touching at school and a further 71% said they heard sexual name-calling towards girls at school daily or a few times per week.
We want it to be made law for schools to train teachers on how to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
Data published in September 2015 showed that 5,500 sexual offences were recorded in UK schools over a three year period, including 600 rapes. 
In 2015 Girlguiding UK found 90% of young women aged 13-21 agree that the government should make sure all schools are addressing sexual harassment and bullying in schools.

attributes.action: Remove the Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Close legal loophole allowing NHS Price cap rules to be bypassed. Criminalise it
attributes.background: Several unscrupulous companies have made millions by legally bypassing the NHS price cap rules, by dropping the brand names of medicines and giving them their generic name.  This has caused astronomical price hikes, and patients are being refused their medicines because the NHS cannot afford them.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3623324/Millionaire-firms-forcing-price-common-NHS-drugs-262MILLION-year-exploiting-branding-loophole.html

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Overhaul the honours system, so only selfless acts of compassion are rewarded
attributes.background: Famous people, people in power and people with money shouldn't get on the honours just because they're in those positions. It's prejudicial. They need to earn it, doing things outside their normal jobs, helping people and the community within our country. Otherwise the honours are meaningless.
attributes.additional_details: The list should be for those who help protect the country and support it outside of their paid duties. Just being rich or doing a job you're paid to do shows innate produce prejudice for the elite. We should encourage compassion and community spirit and love of our country, but the current system teaches us that if you're in the elite, or you're friends with the PM, that's all that matters. It's not supposed to be there as the PM's private thank you card.

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from £35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Nit Nurse and make lice treatments free for children up to age 16
attributes.background: The lack of nit education and Nit treatments being taken off the minor ailment scheme results in more infestations and less treatment being administered. With most brands of treatment ranging from £8-£15 per treatment it is a costly affair to treat the whole family effectively.
attributes.additional_details: The reinstatement of the Nit Nurse in all primary schools and the access to free head lice treatment will go a long way to combat the problem.

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.
